MAN.TITLE: Matplot_properties
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: description of the Matplot entities properties

DESCRIPTION.P: The Matplot entity is a leaf of the graphics entities hierarchy. It represents 2D plots of surface using colors and images (see Matplot and Matplot1).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: parent:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This property contains the handle of the parent. The parent of the Matplot entity should be of the type "Axes".

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: children:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This property contains a vector with the children of the handle. However, Matplot handles currently do not have any children.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: visible:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field contains the visible property value for the entity . It should be "on" or "off" . By default, the plot is visible, the value's property is "on". If "off" the plot is not drawn on the screen.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: data:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field defines a [mxn] color data matrix using the current colormap. The color associated to color(i,j) is used do draw a small square of length 1 with center at location (x=j,y=(m-i+1)).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: user_data:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field can be use to store any scilab variable in the Matplot data structure, and to retreive it.

MAN.EXAMPLE:
set("figure_style","new") //create a figure
Matplot((1:xget("lastpattern"))) e=gce(); // get current entity
e.data=e.data($:-1:1) // reverse order
